section-1.name: Section 1
section-1.title: Leadership, culture, & skills
section-1.description: Digital isn't a list of things to do. It's about how you think, how you behave, what you value, and what drives decisions in your organisation

questions.title: Do your senior leaders (senior management, board and trustees) understand the need to adapt to a digital world? *

options.answer: Digital is not recognised as important and is not often discussed at a senior level
Digital is recognised as important to our future but progress just doesn't happen
There is a good level of senior engagement, we are slowly improving our digital services
Digital is a strategic priority, enabled by leadership, digital progress is happening
Digital is embedded into what we do – it cuts across all areas and is part of our daily practices

questions.title: In the workplace, staff are encouraged and empowered to... (tick all that apply)
How well do you understand the digital skills of your staff and/or volunteers? *

options.answer: We don't know what digital skills or gaps exist in our workforce
We believe that our staff have the basic skills necessary to perform their roles
We have a good understanding of the skills of our staff – but no training offer to develop further
We have an active digital skills assessment and development programme

section-2.name: Section 2
section-2.title: Tools & equipment
section-2.description: Which digital tools are your charity making use of? With a host of online tools and platforms out there, it's never been easier to try new solutions

questions.title: Which of these technologies does your organisation use? (Tick all that apply)

options.answer: Email campaign management (e.g. MailChimp, Campaign Monitor)
Social Media Management tools (e.g. Hootsuite, Sprout Social)
Online donations or payments (e.g. WorldPay, NetBanx)
Messaging and/or collaboration tools (e.g. Slack, Yammer)
Project management tools (e.g. Microsoft Project, Basecamp)
CRM - Customer Relationship Management (e.g. Salesforce, Dynamics)

questions.title: Do you find your IT provision (technical support, hardware setup, internet access) to be... *

options.answer: a regular headache which affects our confidence in trying new things
sufficient for where we are currently, but improving systems would cause issues
well managed and the occasional hiccup aside, is not a barrier to our development
excellent, we are confident that our needs will be met in most circumstances

questions.title: Roughly what percentage of your income/fundraising is paid in using online payments as opposed to offline transactions? *

section-3.name: Section 3
section-3.title: Content & Marketing
section-3.description: Digital tools and approaches make it dramatically easier to reach thousands of people, and more importantly, to hear about their needs and priorities

questions.title: Which of the following content types do you use within your organisation? (Tick all that apply)
Which of the following approaches do you use to understand the needs of your users in developing or improving your services? (Tick all that apply)

options.answer: Focus groups / face to face workshops
Social media usage data (Facebook insights/Twitter stats)
Social media engagements (comments, posts, direct messages)

section-4.name: Section 4
section-4.title: Data management
section-4.description: Using digital tools means charities can access large amounts of real-time data. But you need a strategic approach to make the most of it

questions.title: Data collection *

options.answer: We don't collect any user data at all
We collect basic data such as name and contact details
We collect a lot of user data (preferences, service use, etc.)

questions.title: Decision making *

options.answer: We don't analyse any data to make decisions
We analyse data as-and-when we need to
We have a reporting framework and analyse our data it to make decisions

questions.title: Data storage *

options.answer: We don't know if we store and use data appropriately
We hold data in several places (databases, 3rd party systems) some of which we don't manage
We are confident that our data is held securely and used appropriately, by us and/or 3rd party systems

questions.title: Risk management *

options.answer: We do not know if our data collection and management is a risk to our organisation
We understand our data collection and management is a risk, steps need to be taken
We have assessed the risks and are confident of how we collect and manage data

questions.title: GDPR - General Data Protection Regulation *

options.answer: We are unaware of GDPR or are unaware of the implications for us
We have some understanding of how it affects us
We feel confident of the processes we have in place to ensure a good level of compliance

section-5.name: Section 5
section-5.title: Cyber resilience & online threats
section-5.description: Putting more information online, and digitising transactions can mean you are more vulnerable to cyber attack. So cyber resilience is more important than ever

questions.title: Which statement best describes your organisation's approach to Cyber Security? *

options.answer: We do not have enough knowledge to discuss cyber threats or security at a senior level
Cyber security has been discussed but it is not seen as a business priority
Discussions have taken place and we have a plan that is still in progress or still to happen
Online threats have been assessed and feature highly alongside other business risks and priorities

questions.title: Has training been delivered to staff in any of the following areas? (Tick all that apply)

options.answer: Hardware security (USB pens, Laptops, tablets & phones)

questions.description: This information enables us to compare your results to {{@root.data.currentSite.for_plural}} of a similar size. If you prefer not to submit this information, you result will be compared to the average of all {{@root.data.currentSite.for_plural}} who have completed the checkup

options.answer: Digital is not recognised as important and is not often discussed at a senior level

options.answer: We don't know what digital skills or gaps exist in our workforce

We have a good understanding of the skills of our staff – but no training offer to develop further
We have an active digital skills assessment and development programme

questions.title: How do you invest in technology? *

options.answer: We are not able to invest in technology
We go with what trusted suppliers recommend
We wait to see what our competitors are using
We carry out lots of research and prepare very comprehensive briefs
We test and learn at a small scale then scale up what works

questions.title: How do you work during projects?

options.answer: Does your team self organise and work autonomously?
Does your team regularly reflect and learn on what worked, and what didn’t work?
Can your team make small incremental changes to service delivery?
Is your project plan broken down into manageable chunks?
Do you have a shared 'definition of done'?

section-5.name: Section 5
section-5.title: Cyber resilience & online threats
section-5.description: Putting more information online, and digitising transactions can mean you are more vulnerable to cyber attack. So cyber resilience is more important than ever

questions.title: Is there Board engagement on cyber security? *

options.answer: We do not have enough knowledge to discuss cyber threats or security at a senior level
Cyber security has been discussed but it is not seen as a business priority
Discussions have taken place and we have a plan that is still in progress or still to happen
Online threats have been assessed and feature highly alongside other business risks and priorities

questions.title: Are you required to achieve compliance with a recognised cyber security certification? *
Which certification scheme have you been asked to comply with? (tick all that apply)
Staff training and knowledge

options.answer: Have your staff and volunteers received cyber security training in the last 12 months?
Do your staff and volunteers know how to report a suspicious email?

questions.title: Which technical controls have you put in place to boost your cyber resilience?

options.answer: Least privilege (ie only granting admin level access where this is needed)

questions.title: In the workplace, staff are encouraged and empowered to... (tick all that apply)
Staff digital essential skills rating *

options.answer: We don’t know what our staff digital skills levels are
Low - Less than 25% of staff have essential digital skills
Medium - 25-50% of staff have essential digital skills
High - 50-75% of staff have essential digital skills
Excellent - More than 75% of staff have essential digital skills

questions.title: Staff digital confidence rating *

options.answer: We don’t know what our staff digital confidence levels are
Low - Less than 25% of staff are confident in their use of digital
Medium - 25-50% of staff are confident in their use of digital
High - 50-75% of staff are confident in their use of digital
Excellent - More than 75% of staff are confident in their use of digital

questions.title: Does your organisation have a digital strategy – independent or linked to your overall business plan / business strategy?

options.answer: We are in the process of creating one

section-2.name: Section 2
section-2.title: Tools & equipment
section-2.description: Which digital tools are your charity making use of? With a host of online tools and platforms out there, it's never been easier to try new solutions

questions.title: Which of these technologies does your organisation use? (Tick all that apply)

options.answer: Email campaign management (e.g. MailChimp, Campaign Monitor)

options.answer: a regular headache which affects our confidence in trying new things
sufficient for where we are currently, but improving systems would cause issues
well managed and the occasional hiccup aside, is not a barrier to our development
excellent, we are confident that our needs will be met in most circumstances

questions.title: What housing management system do you use?
How do you rate your Housing Management System? *

options.answer: Very bad - not fit for purpose, no integration
Bad - does some things but not working well
OK - manages basic tasks, used well by some staff
Good - working well and used by all staff
Excellent - very effective, used by all staff and well integrated

questions.title: Can you tell us how much you spend per year on your Housing Management System and IT infrastructure i.e. CRM, Asset management and finance systems? *
How would you rate your past or current experience with procuring a new supplier? *

options.answer: We found it difficult to articulate our service needs during the procurement exercise
We managed to adequately articulate our service needs during the procurement exercise
We were confident and understood what we needed to articulate for our service needs during the procurement exercise

questions.title: How would your rate your experience with suppliers with the tender responses we receive when procuring digital services? *

options.answer: Not satisfied - they didn't meet our requirements
Satisfied - they met some of the requirements
Highly satisfied - they met all of our requirements

section-6.name: Section 6
section-6.title: Technology Enabled Care
section-6.description: Technology Enabled Care (TEC) is the term used when any form of digital technology is used to support someone’s health and/or wellbeing e.g. to keep in touch with friends and family, to get help in an emergency, to control their living environment, to get information / advice to help manage a condition, to connect with health or care services remotely.

questions.title: Do you provide information or forms of Technology enabled care in your organisation? *

options.answer: We do not currently provide any information to tenants about how technology could support their health or wellbeing or where they could get more information
We have started to undertake some pockets of activity to introduce our tenants to TEC
We have trained some staff who offer some TEC solutions to some of our tenants

We have trained all of our workforce on the benefits of TEC, introduced a variety of TEC solutions in consultation with tenants and have integrated technology into all services that we offer to support tenants of all ages

questions.title: Do you know about the TEC in Housing (TECH) Charter? It consists of 7 pledges that your organisation can make to commit to adopting Technology enabled care.
questions.description: To find out more/sign up go to https://techousing.co.uk/the-charter-pledges *

options.answer: We have signed up to the TEC in Housing (TECH) Charter as we understand how TEC can benefit our tenants and our organisation
We are aware of the TECH Charter and are in the process of signing up to it
We are not aware of the TECH Charter
We are aware of the TECH Charter but do not think it is relevant to our tenants or our organisation

questions.description: Which of the sections you have just completed is your highest or most immediate priority?

questions.title: I can turn on a device
questions.description: Finding the power button and logging in

questions.title: I can use the controls on a device
questions.description: Using a touchscreen, keyboard, mouse or trackpad

questions.title: I can use accessibility tools on my device to make it easier
questions.description: Volume settings, making text bigger, brightness settings

questions.title: I can interact with the home screen or desktop on my device
questions.description: Launching applications, finding ‘home’ or the desktop

questions.title: I can connect my device to a safe and secure internet connection
questions.description: Opening internet connection settings and connecting a secure network

questions.title: I know that my passwords and personal information must be kept safe as they have a value to others
questions.description: Sharing your password is like giving someone the keys to your house

questions.title: I can update and change my password when prompted to do so
questions.description: Understanding how to create a strong password and making changes to it if you need to

questions.title: I can communicate online using messaging apps such as WhatsApp and Messenger and can send photos, videos and media links
I can post and reply to comments on social media platforms such as Instagram and Facebook in a respectful and appropriate manner
I can create video content to be shared on social media platforms such as YouTube, Tik Tok and Snapchat
I can use apps such as FaceTime, Zoom and Skype to make video and audio calls
I can set up an email account and use it to communicate, collaborate and share documents with others
I can use the internet to access online public and health services such as Universal Credit or NHS Near me
I can access and use online banking websites and apps
I can set up secure personal accounts enabling me to purchase goods or services safely online
I can complete online forms and upload documents and photographs when required to such as when applying for a passport or driving licence
I can use transport apps and travel websites such as Scotrail or Google Maps to make travel arrangements
I can search for news and online information using a browser such as Chrome, Internet Explorer or Safari
I can clear my browser and online search history
I can use multiple tabs on my internet browser and use bookmarks to save and retrieve information
I can use an online cloud storage account such as iCloud or One Drive and access it from different devices, such as a laptop or a smartphone
I can access entertainment and music online using apps such as Netflix, BBC iPlayer, Spotify, Audible and Amazon Prime
I can use websites, chat bots, online tutorials, FAQs and advice forums to solve problems online
I can find and use online alternatives to my usual sites and apps if they are unavailable
I can use online language and translation tools when required
I can use the internet to find advice and guidance on important issues such as public health information
I can use online tools such as Google Maps to find the best route depending on my mode of transport

I can use applications such as PowerPoint and Google Slides to present information
I can use online productivity tools such as Trello to plan out projects and create action plans
I can use online information to find and use media and accessibility settings on my device
